script.name: plugin.piracy.lootwreck
script.description: Piracy: Loot Wreck: Loot ship and station debris using slaves

comment.var: LOOT WRECK by MISTER BEAR v1.25 Dec-2010
NOTE: Local variables cannot be stored on ship/station debris objects so

line.comment: *I've stored data for them in a global array:

comment.var: GLOBAL DATA: ARRAY( KNOWN WRECK 1, KNOWN WRECK 2, ... , KNOWN WRECK n )
KNOWN WRECK: ARRAY( DEBRIS OBJECT, SHIP NAME, CONDITION %, COMPONENT 1, ..., COMPONENT n )
ABORT IF NO TARGET (should never happen)
------- CHECK FOR EXISTING / GENERATE NEW SALVAGE DATA -------
CHECK WHETHER PLAYER HAS ALREADY ENCOUNTERED THIS WRECK
COMPARE DEBRIS OBJECT WITH STORED OBJECTS
IF WRECK IS UNKNOWN, GENERATE NEW DATA AND SAVE IN GLOBAL ARRAY
DISPLAY DIFFERENT INSTRUCTIONS IF WRECK HAS SELF DESTRUCTED
NAME : "You have found the wreck of an old..."

line.text: add custom menu info line to array

comment.var: INSTRUCTIONS : 'you can send over slave gangs ..'

line.text: add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array

comment.var: DAMAGED: component is too badly damaged..

line.text: add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array
create text for custom menu, left=
add custom menu heading to array

comment.var: SLAVES AVAILABLE : 'Workers available for extracting components'

line.text: create text for custom menu, left=
add custom menu item to array

comment.var: CARGO SPACE AVAILABLE : 'Cargo space available: %s units |********---|'

line.text: get free volume of cargo bay
create text for custom menu, left=
add custom menu item to array

comment.var: CARGO BAY CLASS LIMIT: 'Cargo bay size limit: %s'

line.text: create text for custom menu, left=
add custom menu item to array

comment.var: VALID COMPONENT DATA ONLY BEGINS AT INDEX [3]
CREATE FIVE COLUMN COMPONENTS HEADER. DEFINE FIVE COLUMNS INITIALLY

line.text: add custom menu heading to array

comment.var: DISPLAY EACH SUB-ITEM AND COLOUR BASED ON VALIDITY
COLUMN 1 : NAME. ('64' is dummy bit flag to prevent colouring yellow)

line.text: add custom menu item to array
add custom menu item to array
add custom menu heading to array
add custom menu item to array
add custom menu item to array

comment.var: EXTRACT DATA DETERMINED BY USER CHOICE
SET SLAVE CASUALTIES BETWEEN 2 ACTUAL and 66%
DESTROY WRECK IF TOO BADLY DAMAGED AND PLAY APPROPRIATE SOUND
PLAY APPROPRIATE SOUND: DISINTEGRATION, SUCCESS, FAILURE, DAMAGE
GENERATE WRECK DATA: Creates data array, populates it and adds to global data array
SETUP ARRAY, SAVE SELECTED DEBRIS OBJ, POPULATE ARRAY.
INSERT INTO GLOBAL ARRAY, NOTE THE INDEX.
GET COMPONENT PROPERTIES: Retrieve component properties, determine if comp. is valid
DETERMINE IF COMPONENT IS VALID (1 or more bit flags == invalid)

line.text: get free volume of cargo bay

comment.var: COLOUR BASED ON COMPONENT STATUS: Colour as: Valid / Cause of problem / Invalid
PARAM: $i : 1, 2 or 4 -- bit flag determined by GET COMPONENT PROPEETIES
CALCULATE COMPONENT WORKFORCE: Calculates slaves required per mission
MINIMUM 5 FOR COMPUTER UPGRADES, MINIMUM 2 FOR EVERYTHING ELSE
ADD COMPONENT AS SALVAGE: Adds a damaged component to the cargo bay

sval.val: Piracy: Loot Wreck: Loot ship and station debris using slaves
LOOT WRECK by MISTER BEAR v1.25 Dec-2010
NOTE: Local variables cannot be stored on ship/station debris objects so
I've stored data for them in a global array
GLOBAL DATA: ARRAY( KNOWN WRECK 1, KNOWN WRECK 2, ... , KNOWN WRECK n )
KNOWN WRECK: ARRAY( DEBRIS OBJECT, SHIP NAME, CONDITION %, COMPONENT 1, ..., COMPONENT n )
ABORT IF NO TARGET (should never happen)
------- CHECK FOR EXISTING / GENERATE NEW SALVAGE DATA -------
CHECK WHETHER PLAYER HAS ALREADY ENCOUNTERED THIS WRECK
COMPARE DEBRIS OBJECT WITH STORED OBJECTS
IF WRECK IS UNKNOWN, GENERATE NEW DATA AND SAVE IN GLOBAL ARRAY
DISPLAY DIFFERENT INSTRUCTIONS IF WRECK HAS SELF DESTRUCTED
NAME : "You have found the wreck of an old..."
INSTRUCTIONS : 'you can send over slave gangs ..'
DAMAGED: component is too badly damaged..
SLAVES AVAILABLE : 'Workers available for extracting components'
CARGO SPACE AVAILABLE : 'Cargo space available: %s units |********---|'
CARGO BAY CLASS LIMIT: 'Cargo bay size limit: %s'
VALID COMPONENT DATA ONLY BEGINS AT INDEX [3]
CREATE FIVE COLUMN COMPONENTS HEADER. DEFINE FIVE COLUMNS INITIALLY
DISPLAY EACH SUB-ITEM AND COLOUR BASED ON VALIDITY
COLUMN 1 : NAME. ('64' is dummy bit flag to prevent colouring yellow)
EXTRACT DATA DETERMINED BY USER CHOICE
SET SLAVE CASUALTIES BETWEEN 2 ACTUAL and 66%
DESTROY WRECK IF TOO BADLY DAMAGED AND PLAY APPROPRIATE SOUND
PLAY APPROPRIATE SOUND: DISINTEGRATION, SUCCESS, FAILURE, DAMAGE
GENERATE WRECK DATA: Creates data array, populates it and adds to global data array
SETUP ARRAY, SAVE SELECTED DEBRIS OBJ, POPULATE ARRAY.
INSERT INTO GLOBAL ARRAY, NOTE THE INDEX.
GET COMPONENT PROPERTIES: Retrieve component properties, determine if comp. is valid
DETERMINE IF COMPONENT IS VALID (1 or more bit flags == invalid)
COLOUR BASED ON COMPONENT STATUS: Colour as: Valid / Cause of problem / Invalid
PARAM: $i : 1, 2 or 4 -- bit flag determined by GET COMPONENT PROPEETIES
CALCULATE COMPONENT WORKFORCE: Calculates slaves required per mission
MINIMUM 5 FOR COMPUTER UPGRADES, MINIMUM 2 FOR EVERYTHING ELSE
ADD COMPONENT AS SALVAGE: Adds a damaged component to the cargo bay
